intro: Artanthe ramiflora, commonly known as the branched artanthe, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its upright, branched stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Artanthe ramiflora is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
